#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make Cup Holder for Using on Trees
#Text=Hi , for all those tree climbers who are too lazy to put your refreshment drink in a thermos , here 's a fun , creative , and easy way to keep from spilling your drink !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Find a tree in your yard .
#Text=Collect 9 sticks off the ground .
#Text=They must not be thin nor thick enough to not break with your knee .
#Text=Four sticks need to be about long ; a little more than your elbow to finger tip .
#Text=Five sticks need to be long ; from elbow to wrist .
#Text=Be prepared to break them .
#Text=Prepare the ties for the sticks .
#Text=Many things will work to hold the sticks together . pipe cleaners , fabric scraps , and yarn are just a couple of ways to hold it together . be creative .
#Text=Pipe cleaners are best ; they are pretty strong for such little thingies .
#Text=Take two of the sticks and cross them at the top ; about from the top of each .
#Text=Take one pipe cleaner and make a plus sign with it ; twisting it around each space between the X. Do the same thing again with another pipe cleaner in the same spot .
#Text=Repeat step 3 with 2 separate sticks .
#Text=Take 1 10 inch stick and repeat steps 3 , but place stick at the bottom of the 1st X stick .
#Text=It should look like a triangle with edges hanging off .
#Text=Do n't forget to do both sides where the sticks cross .
#Text=Repeat step 5 , except with the 2nd set of X 's .
#Text=Connect them !
#Text=At the top of both triangles , where the X 's are , place stick vertically with of space between top triangle and bottom triangle .
#Text=Take 3 pipe cleaners ( or as many as necessary ) and just weave it around the connection . they are there to keep it from moving . use as many pipe cleaners as you need .
#Text=Repeat step 7 and 8 with the remaining sticks at the bottom of the triangle .
#Text=It should look like a 3D triangle with edges poking out and colorful pipe cleaners . now just see if your drink fits .
#Text=It should be snug .
#Text=If it 's not , then scoot the sticks together a bit more .
#Text=Take of some pipe cleaners if it wo n't budge .
#Text=Take a piece of tall knit , spandex , or whatever fabric you prefer that does n't catch ( like a run in panty hoses ) and is stretchy .
#Text=Wrap it around the triangle many , many times .
#Text=As many as it will go .
#Text=With your hand , move the fabric in the middle of the triangle up at the top and down at the bottom to fit in can . move fabric back into place after drink is secured .
#Text=Take a ( depending on how far you are going ) piece of rope and tie to a tree limb in the tree you want to climb in .
#Text=Tie rope to top of cup holder .
#Text=Pull the rope like a pulley system to the resting spot of your choice and be happy !
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you have a bottle , then change the lengths and dimensions in which this is made .
#Text=Cut off the leftover edges ; give it a lot of breathing room with the length .
#Text=Use colorful fabric and pipe cleaners to add a bit of spunk .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=This will eventually break .
#Text=Do not leave out in extreme weather , winds , or rain .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Pipe cleaners , yarn , fabric scraps , or other material that wo n't break easily
#Text=A decent sized tree to climb
#Text=Rope
#Text=Spandex , knit , or others stretchy fabric
#Text=Coke or other drink can
